definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Do not wave on a boat, or you will fall into the water.
sentences.chinese: 行舟過渡時不要亂動，小心落水。

sentences.english: In the evening, the crestfallen little dog walked by a big tree.
sentences.chinese: 在晚上，小狗垂頭喪氣的在大樹前亂動。

sentences.english: The beams can not move heedlessly , buyers have to qualify to reduce visual impairment.
sentences.chinese: 由於樑柱不能亂動，買家只好以修飾減少視覺障礙。

sentences.english: And I shouldn't have played with my slides this morning.
sentences.chinese: 我早上不應該亂動我的幻燈片。

sentences.english: Somebody's been monkeying with my papers again.
sentences.chinese: 有人又在亂動我的文件了。

sentences.english: Keep your brats off my property.
sentences.chinese: 別讓你的小孩子亂動我的財物。

sentences.english: He unwinds the still jerking body, and tosses it out the window.
sentences.chinese: 他解開那條仍然在亂動的黑蟲，把它扔到窗外。

sentences.english: Sorry, pal. There's a mummy on the loose.
sentences.chinese: 對不起啦，朋友，那邊有個木乃伊在亂動。

sentences.english: At the first sign of trouble, the smartest thing to do is freeze.
sentences.chinese: 一旦發現有麻煩了，最明智的舉動就是別亂動。

sentences.english: Someone has been tampering with the machine.
You'll break the TV if you don't stop monkeying with it.
sentences.chinese: 別亂動電視機了，你會把它弄壞的。

sentences.english: You have to move the screen around to find the sweet spot and then you can’t move.
sentences.chinese: 你需要移動屏幕來找到甜點之後就不要亂動了。

sentences.english: Two major causes of sleep disorders in babies are behavioral problems and parasomnias.
sentences.chinese: 小孩睡覺亂動的兩個主要因素是行爲問題和異態睡眠。

sentences.english: Don’t touch the instruments unless the teacher allows you.
sentences.chinese: 沒有老師的允許，不要亂動儀器。

definition: to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to be unable to move a single step
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
to run around all over the place
